general.name: blue.enable
general.description: Enables Bluetooth functionality by bringing up the hci0 interface, unblocking Bluetooth, and printing 'done'.
general.command: sudo hciconfig hci0 up > /dev/null 2>&1 && sudo hciconfig hci0 > /dev/null 2>&1 && sudo rfkill unblock bluetooth > /dev/null 2>&1 && echo done

general.name: blue.list
general.description: Lists Bluetooth devices and their status.

general.name: capture.all
general.description: Capture all packets on a specified network interface.

general.name: capture.all.from_ip
general.description: Capture all packets from/to a specified IP address on a specified network interface.

general.name: capture.one
general.description: Capture only one packet on a specified network interface.

general.name: capture.one.from_ip
general.description: Capture only one packet from/to a specified IP address on a specified network interface.

general.name: crack.keepass
general.description: Crack KeePass database encryption using Hashcat

general.name: crack.luks1
general.description: Crack LUKS1 disk image encryption using Hashcat

general.name: crack.luks2
general.description: Crack LUKS2 disk image encryption using Hashcat

general.name: crack.pcap
general.description: Crack WPA/WPA2 encryption in PCAP files using Hashcat

general.name: crack.zip
general.description: Crack ZIP file encryption using Hashcat

general.name: disk.dump
general.description: Create a disk dump from a specified input device to an output file.

general.name: disk.recover
general.description: Carve files from a specified disk image using foremost.

general.name: dos.longpw
general.description: Send and X number of get requests without data

general.name: dos.spam
general.description: Send and X number of get requests without data

general.name: fhide.embed
general.description: Hides a file within a cover image or audio file using Steghide.

general.name: fhide.extract
general.description: Extracts hidden data from a cover image or audio file using Steghide.

general.name: fhide.info
general.description: Displays information about a cover file, including any hidden data, using Steghide.

general.name: file
general.description: Utility used to determine the type of a file.

general.name: file.bin
general.description: Switch to bits (binary digits) dump, rather than hex dump.

general.name: file.by
general.description: lsof alias

general.name: file.str
general.description: Strings alias

general.name: file.clean.meta
general.description: Removes all metadata from an image to protect privacy

general.name: file.dec
general.description: Takes a hexadecimal dump and converts it back into binary format.

general.name: file.dump
general.description: Output in PostScript continuous hex dump style. Also known as plain hex dump style.

general.name: file.hex
general.description: creates  a hex dump of a given file or standard input.

general.name: file.list
general.description: Create a C header file from a binary file. This header file contains a C array definition representing the binary data in hexadecimal format.

general.name: file.meta
general.description: Extracts and displays all metadata from an image file using exiftool.

general.name: firewall.drop.bigger
general.description: Drop all outcome port bigger than expecified port
general.command: iptables -A OUTPUT -p tcp --dport @@port: -j DROP && iptables -A OUTPUT -p udp --dport @@port: -j DROP && ip6tables -A OUTPUT -p tcp --dport @@port: -j DROP &&    ip6tables -A OUTPUT -p udp --dport @@port: -j DROP

general.name: firewall.drop.in.all
general.description: Drop all incomme connections
general.command: iptables -A INPUT -p tcp -j DROP && iptables -A INPUT -p udp -j DROP && ip6tables -A INPUT -p tcp -j DROP && ip6tables -A INPUT -p udp -j DROP

general.name: firewall.drop.out.all
general.description: Derop all outcome connections
general.command: iptables -A OUTPUT -p tcp -j DROP && iptables -A OUTPUT -p udp -j DROP && ip6tables -A OUTPUT -p tcp -j DROP && ip6tables -A OUTPUT -p udp -j DROP

general.name: firewall.flush
general.description: Remove all firewall rules non-resible

general.name: ftp.connect
general.description: Connects to an FTP server at the specified address.

general.name: qrcode
general.description: Create a QR code from the provided data.

general.name: map.auth
general.description: Deal with authentication credentials (or bypassing them) on the target system

general.name: map.default
general.description: Default set of nmap NSE scripts, same as nmap [options] -sC [ip or dns]

general.name: map.discovery
general.description: Try to actively discover more about the network by querying public registries, SNMP-enabled devices, directory services, and the like.

general.name: map.dns
general.description: Return common DNS information and reverse DNS

general.name: map.dns.dirs
general.description: scans a domain for directories with a specified wordlist, and saves the results to an output file.

general.name: map.dns.subdomain
general.description: It scans a domain for subdomains using the specified wordlist and saves the results to an output file.

general.name: map.local
general.description: Scan local open connections

general.name: map.myip
general.description: Show the current ip address

general.name: map.safe
general.description: Perform general network discovery, are less likely to offend remote administrators

general.name: map.vuln
general.description: Check for specific known vulnerabilities and generally only report results if they are found.

general.name: nuke.file
general.description: Securely overwrites and deletes a file seven times, then removes it from the filesystem to prevent data recovery.

general.name: nuke.hd
general.description: Securely overwrites and deletes the contents of a device seven times

general.name: nuke.logs
general.description: Securely overwrites and deletes the /var/logs

general.name: scp.copy
general.description: Creates a directory named 'out' and copies files from a specified folder to a remote host via SCP.

general.name: self.setup
general.description: Setup and install witch_craft
general.command: sudo apt install -y nmap whois dirb dnsenum libc-bin iproute2 xxd iptables coreutils wget curl dnsutils traceroute openssl openssh-server xattr libimage-exiftool-perl tor foremost pkg-config libssl-dev steghide doas nala

general.name: server.eviltwin
general.description: Start a http server that display an local webpage and collect all request data in plain text

general.name: smbclient.access
general.description: Accesses a specific share on the specified address.

general.name: smbclient.list
general.description: Lists available shares on the specified address.

general.name: span.text
general.description: Sends a POST request with JSON data containing a 'main' field and a message field specified by @@message to a specified domain.

general.name: maidz
general.description: An cute cat girl tells you basic system information like neofetch

general.name: search.ans
general.description: Search ans for ipv4 and ipv6

general.name: search.geoloc
general.description: Geolocation search for coordinates

general.name: search.proxy
general.description: Search proxy for IP routing

general.name: search.ipscore
general.description: IP scoring for security (CIN score)

general.name: search.meta
general.description: Social media profile search in over 1000 platforms

general.name: view.applogs
general.description: Applogs typically refer to logs generated by specific applications or software. They contain information about the operation, performance, and errors of the application.

general.name: view.auditlog
general.description: auditlog: Audit messages, tracking system events for security auditing.

general.name: view.authlog
general.description: authlog: Authentication-related messages.

general.name: view.btmp
general.description: btmp: Records failed login attempts.

general.name: view.kernlog
general.description: kernlog: Kernel-related messages.

general.name: view.lastlog
general.description: lastlog: Records last login information for all users.

general.name: view.messages
general.description: messages: System messages, including kernel and service messages.

general.name: view.secure
general.description: secure: Security-related messages, including authentication and authorization events.

general.name: view.syslog
general.description: syslog: General system messages.

general.name: view.wtmp
general.description: wtmp: Records all user logins and logouts.

general.name: web.download
general.description: Full website downloader
general.command: wget --recursive -U 'Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:130.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/130.0' --page-requisites --html-extension --convert-links --restrict-file-names=windows --random-wait --wait=@@wait --limit-rate=200k --tries=inf --domains example.com --no-parent @@url
